update.description:
Set `ENABLE_TESTS_COMPILATION` to false when not building tests, this doesn't work for all projects, sdformat for example doesn't take it.

Also moved ign-common to be built before ign-gui, because gui depends on it.
update.title: Don't build tests for dependencies

content.raw: I'll decline this, because it refers to old code
content.html: I'll decline this, because it refers to old code

content.raw: Sounds reasonable to me, thanks for looking into the alternative approach. I was just hoping to speed up CI a tiny bit :)
content.html: Sounds reasonable to me, thanks for looking into the alternative approach. I was just hoping to speed up CI a tiny bit :)

content.raw:
We are assuming that all the software that is using the generic build script (gazebo has its own script, that is the reason why is not failing with this branch) support the `ENABLE_TEST_COMPILATION` parameter, which I think it is too much assume. In fact, that parameter is a custom artifact that I created at some point buy my plans now are to move the building systems in the same way that gazebo on default branch is working and use the [CTest variable](https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.1/module/CTest.html) `BUILD_TESTING`.

At this point, the best approach I can see is to include some logic inside the different software scripts that support `ENABLE_TEST_COMPILATION`. Let me create a different PR for this to see if we can make it in that way.
content.html:
We are assuming that all the software that is using the generic build script (gazebo has its own script, that is the reason why is not failing with this branch) support the ENABLE_TEST_COMPILATION parameter, which I think it is too much assume. In fact, that parameter is a custom artifact that I created at some point buy my plans now are to move the building systems in the same way that gazebo on default branch is working and use the CTest variable BUILD_TESTING.

At this point, the best approach I can see is to include some logic inside the different software scripts that support ENABLE_TEST_COMPILATION. Let me create a different PR for this to see if we can make it in that way.

content.raw:
It built and tested fine.

I think this may only be a problem if we try to build gazebo8+ from source as a dependency of another project, because in that case Gazebo's tests wouldn't run.
content.html:
It built and tested fine.

I think this may only be a problem if we try to build gazebo8+ from source as a dependency of another project, because in that case Gazebo's tests wouldn't run.

content.raw: My only concern with adding this is that gazebo8 fails if the `ENABLE_TESTS_COMPILATION` flag is set; so we should test this also with a gazebo8 or gazebo default build.

content.raw:
what about the following:

~~~
if $GENERIC_ENABLE_TESTS; then
  BUILDING_EXTRA_CMAKE_PARAMS="${BUILDING_EXTRA_CMAKE_PARAMS} -DENABLE_TESTS_COMPILATION=false"
fi
~~~
content.html:
what about the following:

if $GENERIC_ENABLE_TESTS; then
  BUILDING_EXTRA_CMAKE_PARAMS="${BUILDING_EXTRA_CMAKE_PARAMS} -DENABLE_TESTS_COMPILATION=false"
fi
